description: The File API represents and reads from file data and metadata. Typically, you get files through other APIs, such as the <input type="file"> element or drag-and-drop events. You may also send file data to other APIs, such as creating images or drawing on canvases.
description_html: The File API represents and reads from file data and metadata. Typically, you get files through other APIs, such as the <input type="file"> element or drag-and-drop events. You may also send file data to other APIs, such as creating images or drawing on canvases.
name: File API

nodejs.notes: Available as a part of the buffer module.
Available as a part of the buffer module.

firefox.notes: Before Firefox 16, the second parameter, when set to null or undefined, leads to an error instead of being handled as an empty dictionary.

firefox_android.notes: Before Firefox for Android 16, the second parameter, when set to null or undefined, leads to an error instead of being handled as an empty dictionary.

ie.notes: IE10 throws InvalidStateError with a TypedArray argument. Consider using MSBuilder as an alternative.

nodejs.notes: Before v16.7.0, the endings option was not supported.

firefox.notes: Before Firefox 12, there was a bug that affected the behavior of Blob.slice(); it did not work for start and end positions outside the range of signed 64-bit values; it has now been fixed to support unsigned 64-bit values.

firefox_android.notes: Before Firefox for Android 14, there was a bug that affected the behavior of Blob.slice(); it did not work for start and end positions outside the range of signed 64-bit values; it has now been fixed to support unsigned 64-bit values.

nodejs.notes: Available as a part of the buffer module.
Available as a part of the buffer module.

notes: Before Firefox 13, the error property returned a FileError object.
From Firefox 13 to Firefox 58, the error property returned a DOMError object.
From Firefox 58, the error property returns a DOMException object.
From Firefox 32 to Firefox 58, the error property returned a DOMError object.
From Firefox 58, the error property returns a DOMException object.

firefox.notes: loadstart event dispatches synchronously (should be asynchronously as per spec).

firefox_android.notes: loadstart event dispatches synchronously (should be asynchronously as per spec).
Using the camera in Android 8.x raises an exception. See bug 1511083.

firefox.notes: createObjectURL() is no longer available within the context of a ServiceWorker.

firefox_android.notes: createObjectURL() is no longer available within the context of a ServiceWorker.

ie.notes: If the underlying object does not have a content type set, using this URL as the src of an img tag fails intermittently with error DOM7009.

firefox.notes: revokeObjectURL() is no longer available within the context of a ServiceWorker.

firefox_android.notes: revokeObjectURL() is no longer available within the context of a ServiceWorker.
